of this operation

classitems.description: Raw query interface for select statements
classitems.name: select

params.name: dbName
params.description: A database name that matches a object key defined in your Nextract config file

params.name: sql
params.description:
SQL statement to execute. Can be a fully formed SQL select statement or
a parameterized one with ":key" placeholders. If the later, then sqlParams
must be an object of key/values to be replaced.

params.name: sqlParams
params.description: (optional) List of key/value params to be subbed out in a parameterized query

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of database rows that match the given select statement

Iterates over elements of collection, returning an array of all elements
that equal the given testValue.
classitems.name: equals

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: valueToTest
params.description: The value being against during each iteration

params.name: propertyToTest
params.description: The object property name being tested against during each iteration

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of all elements that equal the testValue

classitems.description:
Iterates over elements of collection, returning an array of all elements
that are greater than the given number.
classitems.name: greaterThan

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: valueToTest
params.description: The value being against during each iteration

params.name: propertyToTest
params.description: The object property name being tested against during each iteration

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of all elements that are greater than the testValue

classitems.description:
Iterates over elements of collection, returning an array of all elements
that are less than the given number.

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: valueToTest
params.description: The value being against during each iteration

params.name: propertyToTest
params.description: The object property name being tested against during each iteration

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of all elements that are less than the testValue

classitems.description:
Creates a duplicate-free version of a collection, using SameValueZero for equality comparisons, in which
only the first occurrence of each element is kept.

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#uniqBy
classitems.name: uniqBy

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: propertyToTest
params.description: The object property name being tested against during each iteration

return.description: Promise resolved with the new duplicate free array

classitems.description:
Computes the maximum value of array. It accepts iteratee which is invoked for each element in
array to generate the criterion by which the value is ranked. The iteratee is invoked with
one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#maxBy
classitems.name: maxBy

return.description: Promise resolved with the maximum value

classitems.description:
Computes the minimum value of array. It accepts iteratee which is invoked for each element in
array to generate the criterion by which the value is ranked. The iteratee is invoked with
one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#minBy
classitems.name: minBy

return.description: Promise resolved with the maximum value

classitems.description:
Computes the mean of the values in array. It accepts iteratee which is invoked for each element in
array to generate the criterion by which the value is ranked. The iteratee is invoked with
one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#maxBy
classitems.name: meanBy

return.description: Promise resolved with the maximum value

classitems.description:
Computes the sum of the values in array. It accepts iteratee which is invoked for each element
in array to generate the value to be summed. The iteratee is invoked with one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#maxBy
classitems.name: sumBy

classitems.description: Custom module used to ...
Used to read files
classitems.name: readFile

params.name: fileType
params.description: Type of file to write; json, csv, or excel

params.name: filePath
params.description: Full path of file to read (include filename and extension)

params.name: parserConfig
params.description:
If fileType is "csv" then you can also pass a
parsing definition to handle the specific needs of your csv. If noe custom parserConfig
is given then a default config of { delimiter: ',', columns: true } is used. The parserConfig
object allow all paser options supported by cvs-parse (http://csv.adaltas.com/parse/).

classitems.description:
Winston logging config
References:
- https://github.com/winstonjs/winston
- http://stackoverflow.com/a/23330037
- http://stackoverflow.com/a/25233851
Used to output files
classitems.name: writeFile

params.name: fileType
params.description: Type of file to write; json, csv, or excel

params.name: data
params.description: An array of objects to be wrtten to the file

params.name: filePath
params.description: Full path of file to write (include filename and extension)

params.name: formattingConfig
params.description:
Object contain config options for the file type being written.
1) If cvs - all options allowed by cvs-stringify (http://csv.adaltas.com/stringify/) are supported
2) If json - the only option is formatting with X number of spaces (e.g.) {spaces: 2}
3) If excel - see https://www.npmjs.com/package/excel4node

classitems.description:
This method is like _.sortBy except that it allows specifying the sort orders of the iteratees to sort by.
If orders is unspecified, all values are sorted in ascending order. Otherwise, specify an order of "desc"
for descending or "asc" for ascending sort order of corresponding values.

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#orderBy
classitems.name: orderBy

return.description: Promise resolved with the new sorted array

classitems.description:
Creates an array of elements, sorted in ascending order by the results of running each element in a collection thru each iteratee.
This method performs a stable sort, that is, it preserves the original sort order of equal elements.
The iteratees are invoked with one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#sortBy
classitems.name: sortBy

return.description: Promise resolved with the new sorted array

classitems.description:
Sorts the elements of an array in place via a custom compare function

For usage reference - https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/sort
classitems.name: customCompare

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: Specifies
params.description: a function that defines the sort order

return.description: Promise resolved with the new sorted array

classitems.description: Utility which runs all passed Promises and returns only once all have been fufilled
classitems.name: runAll

params.name: promisesToRunAn
params.description: array of Promises

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of Promise resolutions

Nextract Plugin Base
Object containing references to core plugins that have loaded in the current program
classitems.name: Plugins.Core

classitems.description: Object containing references to vendor plugins that have loaded in the current program
classitems.name: Plugins.Vendor

classitems.description:
Used to mixin the functionality of a core or 3rd party vendor ETL plugin. These
plugins are located in plugins/core & plugins/vendor.
classitems.name: loadPlugin

params.name: pluginTypes
params.description: Type of plugin being imported (Core or Vendor)

params.name: pluginNames
params.description: Plugin(s) to import
